p: Saponins, such as glycyrrhizin, on the other hand, are steroid glycosides or polycyclic terpene used for the synthesis of cortisone (anti-inflammatory) and sex hormones. They increase the uptake and use of certain minerals [ 106] and can form complexes with steroids, proteins, and membrane phospholipids determining important biological properties such as changes in cell membrane permeability [ 77].
